title: Manage OO Central license
content:
This topic describes how to manage OO Central license as suite admin and tenant admin. 

Concurrent workflow licenses

The concurrent workflow license plan counts the number of workflow executions (OO native and CloudSlang flows) that may include parallel lane execution in unlimited workers. For example, suppose you have purchased 10 concurrent workflow licenses and have five Central workers set up in your environment. In that case, you can only run 10 workflows (including a limited parallel lanes execution) irrespective of the five Central workers used in your environment. If you need to execute the eleventh workflow, you must buy an additional concurrent workflow license.

Triggering new flow executions when AutoPass License Server (APLS) connection is unavailable is not possible by default.

Manage license as a suite admin

Upload license

Follow these steps to upload the OO licenses:

  1. Log in to the OO AutoPass License Server https://<OO_HOST>:<OO_PORT>/autopass
  2. Click the CONFIGURATION menu, and then select the Install option under the LICENSE submenu.
  3. Click Add File(s) to browse and select the appropriate OO license files.
  4. Click Next. The uploaded license appears with license information.
  5. Click Install Licenses. The View tab appears with the details of the license applied.

Associate OO license to newly created OO tenant

Associate OO license to each newly created OO tenant, as follows:

  1. Log on to the OO AutoPass License Server https://<OO_HOST>:<OO_PORT>/autopass.
  2. Click the CONFIGURATION menu, and then select the View option under the LICENSE submenu.
  3. On the VIEW tab, click the Select Product drop-down to choose Operations Orchestration.
  4. Select the License Feature check box and then click Assign. A pop-up dialog appears.
  5. In the Assign License dialog, notice the Select Product field auto populates the chosen product.
  6. Click the Select Tenant drop-down, and then select the applicable Tenant ID, from the displayed list. For example, 306306306.
  7. In the Capacity field, enter the desired license capacity for the tenant.
  8. Leave the Expiry Date field as is.
  9. Select Default Expiry Date check box. The predefined expiry date applies, and the Expiry Date field gets disabled.
  10. Click Submit. A pop-up dialog confirming the license applied on the tenant displays.
  11. Click Close.
  12. To verify the license applied on the Tenant, click the Tenant tab.
  13. On the TENANT tab, click the Select Tenant drop-down and choose the tenant ID.
  14. Verify the details of the license applied.

Manage license as a tenant admin

Upload license

Follow these steps to upload the OO licenses:

  1. Log in to the OO AutoPass License Server https://FQDN:PORT/autopass/?tenant=<id>.
  2. Click the CONFIGURATION menu, and then select the Install option under the LICENSE submenu.
  3. Click Add File(s) to browse and select the appropriate OO license files.
  4. Click Next. The uploaded license appears with license information.
  5. Click Install Licenses. The View tab appears with the details of the license applied.
